questions.question: From which group did Andrew Jackson receive the most support in the election of 1828?

choices.answer: Republicans
Common People
Rich/Upper Class
American Indians

questions.question: What was the central principle of Jacksonian Democracy?

choices.answer: spreading political power to common people
practicing the spoils system & supporting industrialization
easing voting restrictions to include women
using tariffs to increase federal revenues

questions.question: What political party was formed by supporters of Andrew Jackson following the election of 1824?

choices.answer: Socialist
Federalist
Republican
Democratic

questions.question: What name refers to Jackson's policy of rewarding his supporters with government jobs?

choices.answer: democracy
mudslinging
the spoils system
a corrupt bargain

questions.question: Which of these describes a tariff?

choices.answer: a tax on the income of workers
a tax on the purchase of property
a tax on goods produced in the United States
a tax on goods imported from outside the UnitedStates

questions.question: What caused the nullification crisis?

choices.answer: removal policies
election of 1828
northern trade policies
southern opposition to tariffs

questions.question: During the nullification crisis, what was really being tested?

choices.answer: the right to ignore Supreme Court decisions
the rights of states to ignore federal laws
the right of states to secede from the United States
the right to pass laws that benefited certain regions

questions.question: Why did President Jackson want to destroy the Bank of the United States?

choices.answer: He thought it benefited the rich over the farmers & workers
He thought the leaders were stealing from the government.
He thought foreign countries were depositing toomuch money.
He thought farmers were borrowing too much money.

questions.question: What did President Jackson support instead of a large national bank?

choices.answer: state banks owned by many of Jackson's political supporters
personal banks owned by individual citizens
stock investments created by wealthy businessmen
interest-free loans created by the United States government

questions.question: Which of these Supreme Court decisions did President Jackson ignore?

choices.answer: States could cancel federal law.
Only Congress could regulate trade.
American Indians had no land rights.
The Bank of the United States was constitutional

questions.question: Why were the Creek, Cherokee,Chickasaw, Choctaw, and Seminole groups the Five Civilized Tribes?

choices.answer: They had never gone to war with the white man.
They had adopted the white man's ways of life
They had representation in an all-white Congress.
They had willingly given up their land to white settlers

questions.question: How did the Indian Removal Act of 1830 originally plan to deal with the Indians?

choices.answer: to make treaties in which Indians would trade land
to remove Indians by military force to western territories
to provide Indians with jobs to support their families
to declare war on Indians who resisted resettlement

questions.question: Why did the laws created by the US support the removal of Indians from their homelands?

choices.answer: to provide a better life for the tribes
to allow for the expansion of agriculture into the west.
to encourage tribes to adopt the white man's culture
to enable Indians to establish farms in more fertile areas

questions.question: How did the Supreme Court interpret the Indian Removal Act?

choices.answer: Tribes could choose to remain on their lands.
Tribes had no right to any land in the new territories.
Tribes had to immediately give up rights to their land.
Tribes would receive rent from farmers using their land.

questions.question: All of the following are true about the "Trail of Tears" EXCEPT

choices.answer: it was the forced removal of Cherokees from Georgia
thousands of Cherokee died during the long walk
it solved the conflict between Indians and white settlers
it helped open territory in Georgia to white settlers

questions.question: Which group was affected most negatively by the administration of President Jackson?

choices.answer: American Indians
African Americans
farmers and laborers
members of the Democratic Party

questions.question: Why did Henry Clay challenge Andrew Jackson's stance on the Bank of the United States?

choices.answer: He hoped it would destroy the Bank of the United States
He hoped it would lead to the creation of state banks
He hoped it would win him the Presidential Election of 1832.
He hoped it would provide access to the Bank of the US

questions.question: Which group of people did campaign posters of Jackson try to reach?

choices.answer: common people
wealthy businessmen
American Indians
All of the Above

questions.question: Which historical event did Andrew Jackson participate in?

choices.answer: the Battle of New Orleans
the Election of 1824
the American Revolution
All of the Above

questions.question: "HE WHO COULD NOT BARTER NOR BARGAIN FOR THE PRESIDENCY"refers to what event?

choices.answer: The deal that Andrew Jackson made with his Vice President
The deal that the House made with the Senate
The deal that John Quincy Adams and Andrew Jackson made.
The deal that John Quincy Adams of made with Henry Clay
